Detailed Description

Author:
Brecht Verstichel
Date:
23-02-2010

This class, SUP_PQ is a blockmatrix over the carrierspace's of the P and Q conditions. This is the motherclass of all the SUP_PQ* classes because I assume that the P and Q condtional will always be used. This class contains two TPM objects, that are independent of each other (by which I mean that TPM::Q(SUP_PQ::tpm (0)) is not neccesarily equal to SUP_PQ::tpm (1)).

Definition at line 21 of file SUP_PQ.h.

void SUP_PQ::fill ( TPM &  tpm  ) 

Fill the SUP_PQ with TPM tpm, which means put:

SZ_tp[0] = tpm
SZ_tp[1] = TPM::Q (tpm)

void SUP_PQ::L_map ( SUP_PQ &  map,
SUP_PQ &  object 
)

Multiply symmetric SUP_PQ blockmatrix object left en right with symmetric SUP_PQ blockmatrix map to form another symmetric matrix and put it in (*this): this = map*object*map

Parameters:

SUP_PQ & SUP_PQ::operator= ( double &  a  ) 

overload operator = number, all the blockmatrices in SUP are put equal to the number a. e.g. SZ = 0 makes all the Matrix elements zero.

void SUP_PQ::sqrt ( int  option  )

Parameters:

Friends And Related Function Documentation

ostream& operator<< ( ostream &  output,
SUP_PQ &  sup_p 
) [friend]

Output stream operator overloaded, the usage is simple, if you want to print to a file, make an ifstream object and type:

object << sup_p << endl;

For output onto the screen type:

cout << sup_p << endl;

Parameters:
output The stream to which you are writing (e.g. cout)
sup_p the SUP you want to print

Reimplemented in SUP_PQG, and SUP_PQGT1.
